> For example, if I will parse two files and compare row by row, I

like to see all the differences and not just the first

Sound=
s to me like you want to compare two files, and not rows - in a similar
way=
 that assertEquals for Strings doesn't just fail on the first difference
in=
 a character.

With other words, what you probably want to do/look for, is =
an assert method
that gathers all differences in two files and then fails w=
ith an appropriate
message if there are any.

Does that sound reasonable?

=
